python-cicero

#

python-cicero is a helper library, or "wrapper", around Azavea's Cicero API for address-based lookup of elected officials, legislative and nonlegislative districts, and election events. python-cicero intends to make it easier for users to interact with the major endpoints of the Cicero API from Python, by providing classes and methods for API calls and response data.

Look at documentation for the following modules:

  • cicero_rest_connection.py, which includes the CiceroRestConnection() class for most interactions with the API
  • cicero_response_classes.py, a set of Python classes that "wrap" the JSON data structures returned by the API
  • cicero_endpoint_constants.py, which defines the API endpoints used by this wrapper
  • cicero_errors.py, which defines two Exception classes you can expect when things go wrong

      • Finally, be sure to visit the Github project page.
